DialogueElement.Speaker: Fergus
DialogueElement.Text: I have a secret if you want to hear it, there is something you must do otherwise, shoo.

DialogueElement.Speaker: Fergus
DialogueElement.Text: There is this thing that brings me pain, the ground must stain with its insides to turn the tides. This thing must croak maybe with a knife or a stroke. now hop to it and go do it.

DialogueElement.Speaker: Fergus
DialogueElement.Text: I already told you what you must do. Kill the hopping beast and bring back a piece of it's leg, now don't make me beg.

DialogueElement.Speaker: Fergus
DialogueElement.Text: The deamon is dead, the ground is red, you made my day now here is your pay. A page for your book, if you'll have a look.

DialogueElement.Speaker: Fergus
DialogueElement.Text: More are on the way, if you choose to stay you'll need help to fight if you want to be all right.

DialogueElement.Speaker: Fergus
DialogueElement.Text: Riddles and rhymes in these crazy times are to earn my trust but first you must know the reply or hear my good-bye.

DialogueElement.Speaker: Fergus
DialogueElement.Text: You'll be sorry when there's an army knocking at your door, you'll find out what's in store.

DialogueElement.Speaker: Fergus
DialogueElement.Text: Quite sad. Me mad? Just a tad. You bad. Bye lad.
